quote: I was injured at work, a brain injury, and have never had to deal with a workers comp or personal injury case ever in my life, being the one hurt.  I had no idea what I needed to do to make sure my family, and myself were going to be taken care of medically and financially.  My wife and I made an appointment with Wallace and Graham to come in and discuss my injury and what our options were and to help understand what we needed to do to make sure we were protected.  On that very first visit we were greeted in the lobby by a lady, who I had no idea who she was, but later would have the greatest respect for.  That lady was Mona Lisa Wallace.  Mona asked me if we were taken care of and how we were doing, if we needed some water, and what the purpose of our visit was.  After we explained to her what had happened to me, Mona dropped everything and sat down with us.  Not only that, she began calling in other attorneys to get their opinions as well.  At first I was extremely overwhelmed by all the questions coming at me from every angle of the room, and when Mona asked everyone listened.  I later found out, this how Mona operates (full speed all the time).  Mona called her daughter in as well, at the time to over see the workers compensation side.  Whitney showed immediately, that the apple does not fall far from the tree.  Whitney assured me that she was going to oversee my case and that if I had any questions to giver her a call.  Both Mona and Whitney gave me not just the work phone numbers but their personal cell phone numbers and emails. (which they may have regretted later, I texted and emailed A LOT) Through out my injury and battles with Workers Comp, Whitney always had time for my calls, emails, texts, and was a shoulder for me to vent to or explain things to me that I would not understand. With a Brain injury you have mood swings and do some things that you really regret.  I once got so confused and frustrated that I sent an email that I terribly still regret to this day to Mona.  I questioned if they were working on my case and if they were questioning everyone.  Later, and as mentioned to this day I regret that email.  During the time of Wallace and Graham handling my case I really went though a lot of trials in my life.  I went through a divorce, PTSD, my mother passed away (and having lost my father 5 years before this really made me feel alone), depression, suicidal thoughts, started a new relationship, got married, bought a home, daughter issues…. Through out all of this Whitney was always there.  Whitney and Mona, and later Chuck were my only consistent in my life. Every meeting with Wallace and Graham I always left feeling like they cared and that I was their priority, ALWAYS. Mona and Whitney, I will never be able to thank you both enough for what you have helped me get through and made me believe in myself more and to understand that my injury wasn’t just a normal concussion. I could go on for days thinking of instances where they really comforted me along the way (like after reading a deposition). Thank you so much to the both of you and EVERYONE at Wallace and Graham. I know that if I still have any questions or if I needed them again for anything, they would be there for me once again.
name: Thomas Fiello
